intro: Zeuxine bidupensis, commonly known as the African rain lily, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Iridaceae family, which includes many ornamental and economically important plants. The plant features grass-like leaves and produces striking, showy flowers with a distinctive violet or purple coloration. Zeuxine bidupensis thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along riverbanks. Its botanical characteristics make it a popular choice for gardens and conservation efforts in its native habitat.
